page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: Fritham-from the old English "fyrtht" -a wood,means a settlement among the trees. Latchmoor Brook-from the old English "laece" meaning a stream and "maere"-a boundary. Its water was used by the Romano-British Potters and the Schultze Gunpowder Factory. Howen Bottom-a variation of "Howden", a deep valley. Homy Ridge -Homy means covered with hollies. Studley Head-"Stedley" a place set aside for pasture or named because of it's association with horse. The Butts and Ashley Cross have tumuli. Romano-British Potteries were situated at Ashley Cross and in Islands Thorn Inclosure in the 3rd and 4th centuries A.D. .The Shultze Gunpowder Factory established itself at Eyeworth Lodge in 1765, nothing remains.
